record.description: Relief of Emperor Darius on a pylon of the 6th century [B.C.E.] palace at Persepolis. This pylon with the sculptured likeness of Darius the Great was unearthed by the Persian expedition of the Oriental Institute of the University of Chicago, excavating the ancient royal palace at Persepolis. The figure of King Darius, with his umbrella bearer, dates from the sixth century B.C.E., and is one of many archeological treasures discovered by the Chicago scientists.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Attached news clipping. Edges are wearing away and folded. Small tear along all sides. Put into mylar.
